2.4 Vector Spaces 37
– Inverse element: If the inverse exists (Ais regular), then A−1 is the
inverse element of A∈Rn×n, and in exactly this case (Rn×n,·) is a
group, called the general linear group.
Deﬁnition 2.8 (General Linear Group) . The set of regular (invertible)
matrices A ∈Rn×n is a group with respect to matrix multiplication as
deﬁned in (2.13) and is called general linear group GL(n,R). However, general linear group
